Key Match Events: Argentina dominated the game, with Julian Alvarez and Alexis Mac Allister running the show in Lionel Messi's absence
Argentina paid tribute and goodbye to legend Angel Di Maria before the match
Argentina came out of the break with intensity, scoring three goals in the second half
Julian Alvarez scored a long-range stunner from 20 yards out in the 84th minute
Paulo Dybala scored the third goal in stoppage-time
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina paid tribute and goodbye to legend Angel Di Maria before the match
Argentina avoided a Copa America hangover in their first match since claiming the 2024 trophy
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni's side stayed atop the CONMEBOL standings in World Cup qualifying, with 18 points out of 21
Argentina holds a five-point lead over second place Uruguay, with Colombia - Argentina's next opponents on Tuesday - in third
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina's victory was an emphatic one, with a 3-0 scoreline
Julian Alvarez looked comfortable in a front-two, and his moment arrived in the 84th minute
Others: Argentina's player ratings were released by GOAL, with Julian Alvarez receiving a 9/10 rating
Nicolas Otamendi completed 96 percent of his 84 total passes
